Comment: This is unusual, but I want to bring my bishop to f4, so I have to provide a square for it to retire in case of Nh5. I am aware this is not for good players...

My plan is the same as always. f6 is not possible right now.

A waste of time, since I would moved c3 anyway. But he cannot know. The purpose of this move can be to relocate the bishop on b6, a much better square, and to push the knight while advancing the center pawn. So it is not really bad.
I have to be aware of a possible Nxd4, since c3 is pinned. Just in case I want to play Qc2 sooner or later.

Tempting him to go c6 again. Nothing really good...
So my Bh5 plan was really not so good. My move is f4, but even I was a little scared not to secure my king. And I need the rook on f.
